org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.delimited
Class AbstractDelimitedStringConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.delimited.AbstractDelimitedStringConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
DelimitedStringToOrderedMapConvertor, OrderedMapToDelimitedStringConvertor
public abstract class AbstractDelimitedStringConvertor
extends AbstractConvertor

Base Converter for delimited string records

Author:
Eddy Higgins, Kris Lachor

setDelimiter

public void setDelimiter(java.lang.String delimiter)
Optional: set the field delimiter character (defaults to comma). If you want tab delimited then your Spring XML config would look like: Note that without quotes handling this value is actually interpreted as a regular expression, so for a "|" character you will need to use a value="[|]" to avoid it being interpreted as a logical-OR. Whereas when it is used with quote handling it is interpreted as a literal string. This looks like a bug that should be fixed (i.e. they should both behave the same way).

Parameters:
delimiter -

Parameters:
quoteChar - set the character that will be used when wrapping fields in quotes

public void setDelimiterAlwaysLiteralString(boolean delimiterAlwaysLiteralString)
If set to true the delimiter will always be treated as a literal string. Either this flag or delimiterAlwaysRegExp can be set to true at the same time.

setEscapeQuoteCharacters

public void setEscapeQuoteCharacters(boolean escapeQuoteCharacters)
If set to true every quote character will be checked for being preceded with an escape character. If it is escaped, it won't be treated as a boundary of a quoted block. If set to false (default), quote characters will never be escaped. The flag takes effect only when protectQuotedFields flat is enabled. Escaping quoted chars only works when the delimiter is a literal string. ToDo: implement escaping quoted chars when the delimiter is a regular expression

See Also:
setQuoteEscapeChar(char)

setQuoteEscapeChar

public void setQuoteEscapeChar(char quoteEscapeChar)
Setter that allows of overriding of the default quote escaping character DEFAULT_QUOTE_ESCAPE_CHARACTER.

Parameters:
quoteEscapeChar - new quote escaping character.

setSmartEscapeQuoteCharacters

public void setSmartEscapeQuoteCharacters(boolean smartEscapeQuoteCharacters)
If set to true, the converter will attempt to auto-escape certain quote characters, namely those that occur between two other quote characters but there's no delimiter occurring between the quote char in question and either of the quotes on its sides. For example (, -the delimiter ' -the quote): 'abc','de'f','ghj' The quote char before the letter f will be auto-escaped. This setting will only take effect if the protectQuotedFields flag is set to true. The flat is self-exclusive with the escapeQuoteCharacters flag. Smart-escaping quoted chars only works when the delimiter is a literal string.

See Also:
setProtectQuotedFields(boolean)

convertDelimitedStringToOrderedMap

protected IOrderedMap convertDelimitedStringToOrderedMap(java.lang.String delimitedString)
Takes the supplied delimited string and chops it via the delimiter character. Each field is then added as an attribute to a map. The attribute name are generated either from the fieldNames list or if this is not defined then automatically generated.

Parameters:
delimitedString - the delimited string to process
Returns:
a map containing an attribute for each field in the supplied string
Throws:
NullRecordException - if the string passed is null
RecordException - if the incoming record does not match up with the structure expected

extractValues

protected java.lang.String[] extractValues(java.lang.String delimitedString)
Takes the supplied delimited string and chops it via the delimiter character. Will strip quotes if the stripEnclosingQuotes flag is set.

Parameters:
delimitedString - the delimited string to process
Returns:
an array of strings corresponding to the fields in the string supplied

extractQuotedValuesLiteralString

protected java.lang.String[] extractQuotedValuesLiteralString(java.lang.String delimitedString,
                                                              char d,
                                                              char quoteChar)
Splits a string using a literal char delimiter. Preserves blocks of characters between quoteChars. This method originally had an algorithm parallel and almost identical to AbstractDelimitedStringConvertor#extractQuotedValuesLiteralString(String, String, char) but operating on chars rather than Strings/StringBuffers. This seemed unnecessary and was replaced by a simple char->String conversion and forward to the method taking a String. Code is cleaner & easier to test at a certain performance cost (approx. 50% longer to execute).

extractValuesLiteralString

protected java.lang.String[] extractValuesLiteralString(java.lang.String delimitedString,
                                                        java.lang.String delimiter)
Splits a string using a literal string delimiter. Does not preserve blocks of characters between quoteChars.

Parameters:
delimitedString -
delimiter -
Returns:
extracted tokens resulting from split operation.

extractQuotedValuesLiteralString

protected java.lang.String[] extractQuotedValuesLiteralString(java.lang.String str,
                                                              java.lang.String delimiter,
                                                              char quoteChar)
Splits a string using a literal string delimiter. Preserves blocks of characters between quoteChars.

This method is quite forgiving of poorly formatted data and will allow a mixture of quoted and unquoted values and partially quoted values, such as:

  • one,two"two",three,four
    will return an array containing
    • one
    • two"two"
    • three
    • four
  • "one,one"one,two,three,four
    will return an array containing
    • "one,one"one
    • two
    • three
    • four
  • "one,one"one,"two,three",four
    will return an array containing
    • "one,one"one
    • "two,three"
    • four
  • "one,"two,"three",four
    will return an array containing
    • "one,"two
    • "three"
    • four
  • "one,"two"three","four"
    will return an array containing
    • "one,"two"three"
    • "four"
  • one,"two,three,four
    will return an array containing
    • one
    • "two
    • three
    • four
Note there is currently no means of escaping quote characters.

Parameters:
str - the string to split
Returns:
a string array containing the (optionally) quoted values delimited by the given delimiter string.
See Also:
setEscapeQuoteCharacters(boolean), setSmartEscapeQuoteCharacters(boolean)

convertOrderedMapToDelimitedString

protected java.lang.String convertOrderedMapToDelimitedString(IOrderedMap map)
                                                       throws RecordException
Convert an ordered map into a delimited String.

If the fieldNames have been provided then use them to get the attribute values from the map. In this case the order that the fields are output is based on the order of the fieldNames.

Otherwise, we output all the attributes from the map in the order that they are encountered by the map.get() call.

Fields will be quoted if necessary (ie. if addNeededEnclosingQuotes is set).

Parameters:
map - the record source
Returns:
DelimitedString representing the ordered map
Throws:
NullRecordException - if the map is null
RecordFormatException - if the field being quoted is not a CharSequence
RecordException

convertOrderedMapToDelimitedStringHeader

protected java.lang.String convertOrderedMapToDelimitedStringHeader(IOrderedMap map)
                                                             throws RecordException
Convert an ordered map into a delimited String header (containing the names of the attributes rather than their values).

If fieldNames has been set then we simply use them. Otherwise we take each attribute in the supplied map and add its name to the list

Fields will be quoted if necessary (ie. if addNeededEnclosingQuotes is set).

Parameters:
map -
Returns:
DelimitedString representing the ordered map header
Throws:
NullRecordException - if the map is null
RecordFormatException - if the field being quoted is not a CharSequence
RecordException
